desc: Notes from a course presented by T Gilb, an Agile coach, on Architectures & engineering tools in an Agile environment.  This article attempts to push an important and vast set of ideas and processes into text.
title: Agile Architectures

desc: Notes about how to make code more resilient and also Message driven. There a variety of options for reactive systems.
title: Reactive Architecture

desc: When writing reusable UI components, ideas for how to manage CSS in them.  Most Apps will be built with a CSS framework, and this should be leveraged.
title: CSS organisation

desc: A review of different ways to assemble CSS, along with a description of methodologies.  With modern apps and tools, good management of CSS is essential.   There are 5 code layouts, and 9 architectures compared.
title: Architectures CSS

desc: PHP design patterns and Structures that I apply & use are analysed in this article. I list over 18 Patterns I use.  Content is evergreen.
title: Design Patterns

desc: A thorough look at the risk factor.  Im examining risk factors from a software engineering perspective, describing it and how to manage it.   Are also addressed within the risk element in software engineering.
title: Review on Risk

desc: A website should be written to support an audience or customers; many people use search tools to add themselves to that audience.  This article describes a categorisation scheme for your audiences.
title: Search utility

desc: On text cleaning, and the algorithms necessary. Within the context of word filtering; I look at goals, requirements, and one example. I analyse the notion of word filtering also during the practice in 2012.
title: Word filtering

desc: Project management for 6 festivals in 12 months, detailed one year planning and cost control. My festival holidays in 2010 are an example of project planning.   This is obviously personal, but was a well organised project.
title: Festivals 2010

desc: Commercial justification for using common engineering practice of OO.  Best practices of OOP, for a business person. Business & developer benefits of OOP are highlighted, along with adoption requirements.
title: The economic and commercial justification for OOP

desc: Discussion on my process of moving a maximum compatibility shell to a more user focussed shell. Objectives for the site and improvements carried out. A discussion about layout is also included in terms of boundaries, colouration, etc.
title: New skin for OB ~ 2013

desc: Why use mongoDB (or NoSQL)?  Because of documentation. The article also concisely looks at a list of pros and cons about using a NoSQL system.
title: Why MongoDB?

desc: Notes for a meeting, regarding non-relational structures.  A list of 10 data storage tools other than RDB, updated in 2023.  The article covers architecture and algorithms.
title: Non-SQL data storage

desc: A concise reference article on how to port tables between DB systems / installations for singular use. It looks at tools that allow best control.
title: Show create table

desc: Analysis: how does MongoDB perform with large scale data? Limits and data modeling on practical upper data-volume for MongoDB with normal hardware. MongoDB is also compared with other data systems.
title: Creating a large scale MongoDB

desc: Drupal 7 was discontinued in Aug 2022. This older article looks at the Drupal 7, the audience it was built for along with a comparison to other CMS at the time.
title: Drupal 7.

desc: A summary of what I did with the Symfony2+ platform and stack in around 2014. This older text lists features of Symfony2+ I used back then while working as a Symfony specialist.
title: Symfony2+ Usage
